sentences: Hänellä on kaksi kieltä: suomi ja ruotsi.
Suomen kieli on vaikea monille ulkomaalaisille.
context: In Finnish, 'kieli' primarily means 'language'. It can refer to any human language or specifically the Finnish language. Additionally, it can also mean 'tongue' as in the physical organ in one's mouth. The word is a common noun and its form shown here is in the singular nominative case.
